If you play with mods like Kerbal Construction Time, the danger to fail a contract is much increased.

With Kerbal Construction Time it actually takes time to build rockets (and the more time, the more expensive your rocket is), research tech nodes and clean the launch pad after a rocket launch.

You can expect rockets to take a week to build or longer.

While, with deadlines for contracts being 1+ years, it still takes a lot of negligience from your part, to fail them, it becomes much less impossible than in vanilla KSP (where, without any building times, you could race through the tech tree and launch dozens of rockets, within a few weeks)
